audit_tests.name: 1.3.1 Ensure that the --terminated-pod-gc-threshold argument is set as appropriate
audit_tests.description: Activate garbage collector on pod termination, as appropriate.
audit_tests.remediation:
Edit the Controller Manager pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube- controller-manager.yaml on the master node and set the --terminated-pod-gc- threshold to an appropriate threshold, for example:
--terminated-pod-gc-threshold=10

audit_tests.name: 1.3.2 Ensure that the --profiling argument is set to false
audit_tests.remediation:
Edit the Controller Manager pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube- controller-manager.yaml on the master node and set the below parameter.
--profiling=false
audit_tests.impact: Profiling information would not be available.

audit_tests.name: 1.3.3 Ensure that the --use-service-account-credentials argument is set to true
audit_tests.description: Use individual service account credentials for each controller.
audit_tests.remediation:
Edit the Controller Manager pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube- controller-manager.yaml on the master node to set the below parameter.
--use-service-account-credentials=true
audit_tests.impact:
Whatever authorizer is configured for the cluster, it must grant sufficient permissions to the service accounts to perform their intended tasks. When using the RBAC authorizer, those roles are created and bound to the appropriate service accounts in the kube-system namespace automatically with default roles and rolebindings that are auto-reconciled on startup.
If using other authorization methods (ABAC, Webhook, etc), the cluster deployer is responsible for granting appropriate permissions to the service accounts (the required permissions can be seen by inspecting the controller-roles.yaml and controller-role- bindings.yaml files for the RBAC roles.
audit_tests.default_value: By default, --use-service-account-credentials is set to false.

audit_tests.name: 1.3.4 Ensure that the --service-account-private-key-file argument is set as appropriate
audit_tests.description: Explicitly set a service account private key file for service accounts on the controller manager.
audit_tests.remediation:
Edit the Controller Manager pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube- controller-manager.yaml on the master node and set the --service-account-private- key-file parameter to the private key file for service accounts.
--service-account-private-key-file=<filename>
audit_tests.impact: You would need to securely maintain the key file and rotate the keys based on your organization's key rotation policy.

audit_tests.name: 1.3.5 Ensure that the --root-ca-file argument is set as appropriate
audit_tests.description: Allow pods to verify the API server's serving certificate before establishing connections.
audit_tests.remediation:
Edit the Controller Manager pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube- controller-manager.yaml on the master node and set the --root-ca-file parameter to the certificate bundle file`.
--root-ca-file=<path/to/file>
audit_tests.impact: You need to setup and maintain root certificate authority file.

audit_tests.name: 1.3.6 Ensure that the RotateKubeletServerCertificate argument is set to true
audit_tests.description: Enable kubelet server certificate rotation on controller-manager.
audit_tests.remediation:
Edit the Controller Manager pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube- controller-manager.yaml on the master node and set the --feature-gates parameter to include RotateKubeletServerCertificate=true.
--feature-gates=RotateKubeletServerCertificate=true
audit_tests.default_value: By default, RotateKubeletServerCertificate is set to "true" this recommendation verifies that it has not been disabled.

audit_tests.name: 1.3.7 Ensure that the --bind-address argument is set to 127.0.0.1
audit_tests.description: Do not bind the Controller Manager service to non-loopback insecure addresses.
audit_tests.remediation: Edit the Controller Manager pod specification file /etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube- controller-manager.yaml on the master node and ensure the correct value for the -- bind-address parameter
audit_tests.default_value: By default, the --bind-address parameter is set to 0.0.0.0
